properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 9:36PM AKST until January 14 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills 40 to 50 below zero.

* WHERE...THOMPSON PASS.

* WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Tuesday. Temperatures and winds could
fluctuate during the daylight hours allowing conditions to warm
temporarily. However in general, wind chills will remain
dangerously cold at least through Tue morning.

* IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause
frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will remain very cold through
the week with the possibility of stronger winds on Wed pushing
wind chills to near 60 below. Please stay tuned to the forecast
for updates.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST TUESDAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS
